column1: Data Supplied By: National Livestock Reporting Service
Data source: National Livestock Reporting Service
Please see terms of use here: https://www.mla.com.au/general/Terms-and-conditions/data-and-information/

1500 head were yarded in what was a plain quality yarding at Blackall this week. Most averages were affected by quality however a run of local steers and heifers sold to solid local demand and prime cows to the processor followed similar trends to the rest of the state.

A small sample of light weight restocker steers under 200kg sold to 430.2c and steers 200 to 280kg made to 414.2c/kg. A run of local steers 330 to 400kg topped at 398.2c while d muscle pens averaged 242c/kg. A limited number of heavy feeder steers sold to 346.2c to avg 336c/kg.

Light weight c muscle restocker heifers made to 312.2c and heavy weight heifers to feed made to 266.2c to average 245c/kg.

Heavy grown steers to the processor sold to 314.2c and heavy heifers made to 302.2c to average 300c/kg. Medium weight prime cows sold to 270.2c to average 245c and heavy weight prime cows made to 275c to average 267c/kg.

Market reporter,
Sam Hart.
